pageContext.claim: “The other thing, one of the papers, the Washington Post, which is a terrible newspaper, started talking about al-Baghdadi as a great religious leader.”
pageContext.analysis: The Washington Post obituary described al-Baghdadi as "an austere religious scholar" who took over the Islamic State in 2010 with "no known aptitude for fighting and killing. But just four years later, Mr. Baghdadi had helped transform his failing movement into one of the most notorious, vicious and — for a time — successful terrorist groups of modern times."
